title: Vijaydurg Fort
subtitle: The Gibraltar of the East
overview: Known as the 'Gibraltar of the East', Vijaydurg Fort is one of Maharashtra’s oldest and strongest sea forts. Originally built by Raja Bhoja II of the Shilahar dynasty, the fort stands majestically on the Konkan coast, surrounded by the Arabian Sea on three sides.
Later captured and expanded by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, Vijaydurg became one of the most important naval bases of the Maratha Empire and played a key role in coastal defense and maritime trade.

highlights.title: Strongest Sea Fort
highlights.description: A massive fort with triple-layered defensive walls and over 20 bastions.

highlights.title: Maratha Naval Base
highlights.description: Served as the main base of the Maratha Navy under Admiral Kanhoji Angre.

highlights.title: Hidden Underwater Wall
highlights.description: A secret underwater wall built to trap enemy ships during low tide.

geography.intro: Vijaydurg Fort is located along the Konkan coast in Sindhudurg district, overlooking the Arabian Sea. Its strategic coastal position made it ideal for naval dominance.

climate.description: Vijaydurg experiences a tropical coastal climate with warm temperatures and high humidity.

seasons.text: Best time to visit is from October to March.
Avoid monsoon season due to slippery terrain and rough seas.

geography.conclusion: Overlooking the Arabian Sea, Vijaydurg Fort remains a symbol of Maratha naval power and coastal defense.

activities.title: Fort Exploration
activities.description: Walk along massive ramparts, bastions, and ancient structures.
info: Allow at least 2–3 hours for exploration.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture panoramic sea views and fort architecture.
info: Early morning and sunset offer best lighting.

activities.title: Local Cuisine
activities.description: Taste authentic Malvani seafood in nearby villages.
info: Try local fish curry and solkadhi.

attractions.title: Sea-Facing Bastions
attractions.description: Massive watchtowers offering breathtaking views of the Arabian Sea.

attractions.title: Hidden Tunnels & Granaries
attractions.description: Secret tunnels, storage rooms, and granaries inside the fort.

marineLife.intro: The waters around Vijaydurg Fort support a diverse marine ecosystem due to clean coastal currents.

items.title: Marine Fish
items.description: Pomfret, mackerel, and other Konkan coastal species.

items.title: Coastal Biodiversity
items.description: Clear waters and rocky seabed visible during low tide.

conclusion: Vijaydurg’s marine environment enhances its scenic beauty.
Low tide reveals the famous underwater defensive wall.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Around 490 km from Mumbai via NH66.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station is Rajapur Road (60 km).
Taxis and buses connect to Vijaydurg.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport is Ratnagiri Airport (220 km).
Road transport available from the airport.

bookingTips.description: Carry sufficient drinking water and snacks.
Wear comfortable shoes for long walks.
Hire a local guide to understand the fort’s history and underwater wall.
